title: Positroids are 3-colorable. (arXiv:2111.06983v3 [math.CO] UPDATED)
description: We show that every positroid of rank $r \geq 3$ has a positive coline. Using the definition of the chromatic number of oriented matroid introduced by J.\ Ne\v{s}et\v{r}il, R.\ Nickel, and W.~Hochst\"{a}ttler, this shows that every orientation of a positroid is 3-colorable.
dc:creator: Lamar Chidiac, Winfried Hochstättler
